Package gov.nasa.larcfm.Util

Interface EuclideanProjection

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AziEquiProjection, ENUProjection, FlatEarthProjection, OrthographicProjection, SimpleNoPolarProjection, SimpleProjection
    public interface EuclideanProjection
    This is an interface for local Euclidean projections around a given point. This projection may be used to transform geodesic coordinates (LatLonAlt objects) into this Euclidean frame, using the project() method. Also points within this frame, may be found in geodesic coordinates with the inverse() method. As long as the points are close to the projection point, the errors should be very small. Euclidean positions will be with respect to a projection point (this becomes the origin of the new Euclidean space). Note that this will often alter relative position altitude information as well! If this is not desired, the projection should be made against a zero-altitude point. EuclideanProjection objects should never be created directly. Instead they should be retrieved via the Projection.createProjection() method. Also please note that, in order to retain expected behaviors (such as projected collisions), it is often necessary to project velocities as well as positions. This is especially the case as you move further from the projection point. These velocities may change in both track and ground speed components through the projection.

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      double conflictRange​(double lat, double accuracy)
      Given an ownship latitude and desired accuracy, what is the longest distance to a intersection this projection will support? (The implementation of this should provide an minimum cutoff range when accuracy is ≤ 0.01 m) [m]
      LatLonAlt getProjectionPoint()
      Get the projection point for this projection
      LatLonAlt inverse​(Vect2 xy, double alt)
      Return a LatLonAlt value corresponding to the given Euclidean position
      LatLonAlt inverse​(Vect3 xyz)
      Return a LatLonAlt value corresponding to the given Euclidean position
      Pair<Position,​Velocity> inverse​(Vect3 p, Velocity v, boolean toLatLon)
      Given a velocity from a point in Euclidean 3-space, return a projection of this velocity and the point.
      Velocity inverseVelocity​(Vect3 s, Velocity v, boolean toLatLon)
      Given a velocity from a point in Euclidean 3-space, return a projection of this velocity.
      EuclideanProjection makeNew​(double lat, double lon, double alt)
      Return a new EuclideanProjection with the given reference point
      EuclideanProjection makeNew​(LatLonAlt lla)
      Return a new EuclideanProjection with the given reference point
      double maxRange()
      What is the maximum effective horizontal range of this projection? [m]
      Vect3 project​(LatLonAlt lla)
      Return a projection of a lat/lon(/alt) point in Euclidean 3-space
      Pair<Vect3,​Velocity> project​(LatLonAlt p, Velocity v)  
      Vect3 project​(Position sip)
      Return a projection of a Position in Euclidean 3-space (if already in Euclidean coordinate, this is the identity function)
      Pair<Vect3,​Velocity> project​(Position p, Velocity v)
      Given a velocity from a point, return a projection of this velocity and the point in Euclidean 3-space.

      Return a projection of a lat/lon(/alt) point in Euclidean 2-space

      Given a velocity from a point in geodetic coordinates, return a projection of this velocity in Euclidean 3-space.

        Parameters:
        sip - point in geodetic space
        Returns:
        point in projected space

      • projectVelocity

        Velocity projectVelocity​(LatLonAlt lla,
                         Velocity v)
        Given a velocity from a point in geodetic coordinates, return a projection of this velocity in Euclidean 3-space
        Parameters:
        lla - point in geodetic space
        v - velocity in geodetic space
        Returns:
        velocity in projected space

      • projectVelocity

        Velocity projectVelocity​(Position ss,
                         Velocity v)
        Given a velocity from a point in geodetic coordinates, return a projection of this velocity in Euclidean 3-space. If the position is already Euclidean, then this method should do nothing.
        Parameters:
        ss - point in geodetic space
        v - velocity in geodetic space
        Returns:
        velocity in projected space

      • inverseVelocity

        Velocity inverseVelocity​(Vect3 s,
                         Velocity v,
                         boolean toLatLon)
        Given a velocity from a point in Euclidean 3-space, return a projection of this velocity. If toLatLon is true, the velocity is projected into the geodetic coordinate space, otherwise it acts as the identity function.
        Parameters:
        s - point in projected space
        v - velocity in projected space
        toLatLon - true, if converting to lat/lon
        Returns:
        velocity in geodetic space

      • project

        Pair<Vect3,​Velocity> project​(Position p,
                                   Velocity v)
        Given a velocity from a point, return a projection of this velocity and the point in Euclidean 3-space. If the position is already in Euclidean coordinates, this acts as the identity function.
        Parameters:
        p - position in geodetic space
        v - velocity in geodetic space
        Returns:
        position and velocity in projected space

      • project

        Pair<Vect3,​Velocity> project​(LatLonAlt p,
                                   Velocity v)

      • inverse

        Pair<Position,​Velocity> inverse​(Vect3 p,
                                      Velocity v,
                                      boolean toLatLon)
        Given a velocity from a point in Euclidean 3-space, return a projection of this velocity and the point. If toLatLon is true, the point/velocity is projected into the geodetic coordinate space.
        Parameters:
        p - position in projected space
        v - velocity in projected space
        toLatLon - true, if converting to lat/lon
        Returns:
        position and velocity in geodetic space
